chapter.title: General structure and usage
chapter.p: The topmost structural units of the library are headers and the library file (or archive) - lib__vic.a or __vic.lib. Usually the library file has some suffix like lib__vic14.a. All the headers are located in the __vic/ subdirectory. One should include them like this:
Where header.h is a name of the desired header.
Almost all the code is placed within __vic namespace, including other namespaces.
During program linking, the library file must be given to the linker. Example:
The library can be built using one of the ISO C++ standards: C++98, C++11, C++14 or C++17. The standard suffix is used as a suffix for the library file (archive).
Some features are available only if minimal required standard version is used, e.g. many features require at least C++11. Such features are marked with C++11 sign that means "C++11 or later".
Some features are available only in particular standard mode and not available otherwise. Such features are marked with C++98 only sign.
Detailed description of the library components provided in subsequent chapters. Descriptions are grouped by headers. Mainly C++14 language syntax is used as more complete and expressive.
